comment.author: 35880966@N04
comment._content: Love these elegant woman. Wish we still dressed up like this.

comment.author: 7339565@N08
comment._content: Great Photos- and good comments!...Reading through many of them, one of the common denominators is that there is a longing for the style and elegance of the past to come back into contemporary vogue. The only way that will happen is if people take the necessary steps to make that happen. Dont wait for someone else to do it- or for the 'rest' of the culture to do it first- YOU do it ! Dont follow the herd- wear a suit  or dress to church or a nice outing- dont get on a plane looking like a slob in blue jeans, flip flops and a tee-shirt ! Dress appropriate to the businees or social occasion ! You will be amazed at the enthusiast respones that you receive from others,  you will glean more respect and dignity for yourself- and you will 'raise the bar' to a higher level of personal appearance and grooming. When enough people adapt this new attitude of looking respectable through their clothing, grooming and the manner in which they comport themselves- that will BECOME the new standard for society. But please, dont wait for 'everyone else' to do it first !

comment.author: 27309380@N06
comment._content:
Wow, many very positive comments about the fashion, that's the main draw for many to this image. I find this image a very unique capture of the era. I'd say judging by the clothes, this photo is around the 1933-34 period. 

As many here are taken with the fashion, I too was so impressed that I've made it a daily occasion to dress in 1930s-40s era clothing, not only is it lovely, it's also very durable and better made, also it fits much nicer! My girl friend also collects clothing of this era! Her and I can be seen in a photo or two in my photos. She's by our refrigerator and I'm by an old train in my original threads. :-)

Let's all try and bring back some style! 

=R

comment.author: 7339565@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27309380@N06] ...Good for you ! This is encouraging to hear...we need to keep the ball rolling and encourage others to do the same !!!

comment.author: 38924839@N06
comment._content: Didn't know the Aussies could be so elegant

comment.author: 27309380@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/7339565@N08] 
Thanks Davethewave, we enjoy dressing in these clothes, I was taken by the 30s/40s fashion way back in the early 90s, I've been doing it for a while and for the most part, it's well received.

comment.author: 7339565@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/27309380@N06]  That is great to hear ! I dress 'proper' as well- where ever I go- wouldn't be caught dead in jeans- even at the grocery store .Peolpe always remember me by my appearance and I always make a good impression ! And why not !!!
Glad to know that there are others that feel the same....!

comment.author: 27309380@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/7339565@N08] 
Amen to that Dave! One is only entitled to one "first impression" may as well make it worth remembering! :-D

An elderly gentleman once said to me that when one dresses neatly, and practices good grooming, it shows respect to others. Makes sense when one thinks about it. :-D

comment.author: 7339565@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27309380@N06]  Double AMEN to that !  The gentleman knew what he was talking about ! I also heard one time that we dress and present ourselves for two reasons- to display the 'person' that we are- or the person that we aspire to be..... If we think about it, this really covers ALL of the bases, both good and bad ! Words to live by !

comment.author: 27309380@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/7339565@N08] 
Oh so true! The way we speak and dress really is a reflection of who we truly are.
